full_summary:
=====================================

**Tender for Technical Writer Services**
-----------------------------------------

### Reference Number and Details

*   **Reference Number:** W6369-24-X005
*   **Title:** Learning Services - One (1) Technical Writer, Level 3
*   **Solicitation Number:** W6369-24-X005
*   **Publication Date:** June 30, 2023
*   **Tender Closing Date:** August 21, 2023 (14:00:00)
*   **Expected Contract Start Date:** Not Specified
*   **Expected Contract End Date:** Not Specified
*   **Contracting Authority:** National Defense Headquarters
*   **Address:** 101 Colonel By Drive, Ottawa, ON K1A 0K2
*   **Contact Information:** Ryan Wong, Ryan.Wong@forces.gc.ca, (819) 939-8266

### Requirement Description

The Department of National Defence (DND) requires the services of a technical writer to review, edit, revise, and update course curriculum and materials used in course delivery to the Canadian Armed Forces (CAF) and Public Affairs employees. The technical writer will be responsible for providing content that meets the needs of the CAF and Public Affairs staff.

### Security Clearance

The contract will require a Common-PS-SRCL#6 security clearance.

### Trade Agreements

The services provided will be subject to the following trade agreements:

*   Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
*   Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
*   Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
*   Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement (CColFTA)
*   Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
*   Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement (CHFTA)
*   Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
*   Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement (CPanFTA)
*   Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
*   Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
*   Canada-United Kingdom Trade Continuity Agreement (CUKTCA)
*   World Trade Organization-Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-GPA)

### Contract Period and Estimated Level of Effort

The services will be required for a period of 3 years with two (2) additional 1-year option periods. The estimated level of effort is 240 days per year.

### Tenders

Eligible companies
